means: 盛装的，正式的，应穿礼服的

sentence.Network_en: Hurstwood's word, however, had gone the rounds . It was to be a full - dress affair.

sentence.Network_en: It was considered to be a full dress ceremony.
sentence.Network_cn: 它被认为是一个正式着装的典礼.

sentence.Network_en: On the evening of December 28 he held a full - dress military conference.
sentence.Network_cn: 12月28日晚上,他召集了一个大规模的军事会议.
